'''Reuniclus''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ランクルス''' ''Lanculus'') is a {{type|Psychic}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Duosion}} starting at [[level]] 41. It is the final form of {{p|Solosis}}.

==Biology==
Reuniclus is a pale green Pokémon surrounded by a blob of translucent, green gelatinous substance. It has a large, round head with a thin stripe down the center. Its eyes are black and oval, while its mouth is red and triangular. Its body is small with stubby arms and legs. However, there are several round objects floating next to its arms. These objects increase in size and darken in color the further they are from the body and form arm-like appendages. The gel around these appendages forms three-fingered hands. Above its head, two rounded, triangular objects are suspended in the gel, giving the impression of horns or ears. The gel forms a stubby, round tail at the base of Reuniclus's body. Reuniclus controls its powerful arms using psychic powers. It can form a network with the brains of other Reuniclus by clasping hands with them.

==In the anime==
[[File:Geraldo Reuniclus.png|250px|thumb|left|Reuniclus in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Reuniclus debuted in ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom]]'', under the ownership of [[Damon]]. It was seen in the film as Damon's partner during his travels, and later battled against [[Ash's Pikachu]]. Several more wild Reuniclus were also seen in a flashback scene in both movies, where they were inside the [[Sword of the Vale]].

===Minor appearances===
A Reuniclus appeared in ''[[BW090|Jostling for the Junior Cup!]]'' and ''[[BW091|Battling Authority Once Again!]]'', under the ownership of [[Geraldo]]. It was seen participating in the [[Pokémon World Tournament Junior Cup]], where it battled [[Cassie]] and her {{DL|Cassie|Sawsbuck}} before losing to {{Ash}} and his {{AP|Boldore}}.

A Reuniclus appeared in ''[[BW105|Lost at the League!]]'', where it was defeated by [[Virgil]]'s {{p|Glaceon}} during the [[Vertress Conference]].

==In the manga==
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In ''[[PS515|The Shadow Triad]]'', a Reuniclus was used by a participant of {{OBP|Pokémon League|Unova}} in a flashback. In the original it was shown to be a {{p|Beheeyem}}.

[[File:Damon Reuniclus M14 manga.png|thumb|125px|Reuniclus in the adaptation of ''{{ma|White—Victini and Zekrom}}'']]

===In the Pokémon RéBURST manga===
After taking the power of [[Arcades]], [[Fraud]] could transform into one of seventeen [[type]]s of Pokémon without the need of a [[Burst]] Heart. His {{type|Psychic}} form was that of a Reuniclus.

===Movie adaptations===
[[Damon]]'s Reuniclus appears in the manga adaptation of ''{{ma|White—Victini and Zekrom}}''. It assists Damon in powering up the [[Sword of the Vale]] and fighting off his opponents.

==Trivia==
* Reuniclus was designed by [[Keiko Moritsugu]].

===Origin===
Reuniclus and the rest of its evolutionary line seem to bear reference to {{wp|Cell (biology)|cells}}, with the green substance surrounding their bodies resembling {{wp|cytoplasm}} and the objects inside their bodies representing {{wp|organelle}}s. The line down its head also resembles a {{wp|cleavage furrow}} in cell biology. It may also make allusion to the {{wp|Embryogenesis|embryonary stages}}, specifically when the embryo is fully developed to become into a {{wp|fetus}}, while the green jelly may represent the {{wp|amniotic fluid}}. The way its organelles are lined up in Reuniclus's arms resemble the generic meter for {{wp|Loudness|volume}} control, most likely referencing the ability to ''amplify'' its powers. Reuniclus also has a strong resemblance to a {{wp|homunculus}}, due to its larger ears, mouth, and hands, to represent a homunculus's ability to amplify. It may also be based partially on an {{wp|amoeba}}, with its arms resembling {{wp|pseudopods}}.

====Name origin====
Reuniclus may be a combination of ''reunite'', ''{{wp|homunculus}}'', and ''nucleus'' or ''cluster''. It may also derive from ''{{wp|unipolar neuron}}''.

Lanculus may be a combination of 乱 ''ran'' (disorder) or 卵 ''ran'' (spawn) and ''homunculus''.
